com.novartis.opensource.yada

Class QueryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.QueryManager

  • public class QueryManager
extends Object
    QueryManager is a workhorse class that performs essential query preparation tasks prior to execution. These tasks include retrieving YADAQuery objects using Finder.getQuery(String), and creating global and query-based data structures for storing and mapping source connections, statements, and results.
    Since:
    0.4.0.0
    Author:
    David Varon
    See Also:
    Service.execute(), Service.handleRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest)

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryManager

        public QueryManager(YADARequest yadaReq)
             throws YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                    YADAResourceException,
                    YADAConnectionException,
                    YADAFinderException,
                    YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException,
                    YADARequestException,
                    YADAAdaptorException,
                    YADAParserException
        Constructor stores config object and JSONParams if necessary, then calls effectively bootstraps query management process by calling processQueries()
        Parameters:
        yadaReq - YADA request configuration
        Throws:
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor can't be instantiated, or when it can't be found
        YADAFinderException - when there is an issue retrieving a query from the YADA index
        YADAConnectionException - when there is an issue opening a connection to a source referenced by a query
        YADAResourceException - when a query's source attribute can't be found in the application context, or there is another problem with the context
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - if request does not contain either a qname or q, or a JSONParams or j parameter
        YADAAdaptorException - when a query cannot be built by the adaptor
        YADARequestException - when filters are included in the request config, but can't be converted into a JSONObject
        YADAParserException - when a query code cannot be parsed successfully
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • processQueries

        private void processQueries()
                     throws YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                            YADAConnectionException,
                            YADAFinderException,
                            YADAResourceException,
                            YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException,
                            YADARequestException,
                            YADAAdaptorException,
                            YADAParserException
        A broker method which calls endowQuery(String) (for standard param requests) or endowQueries(JSONParams) for json params requests, followed by prepQueriesForExecution() in succession
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - when there is an issue retrieving a query from the YADA index
        YADAConnectionException - when there is an issue opening a connection to a source referenced by a query
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - if request does not contain either a qname or q, or a JSONParams or j parameter
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor can't be instantiated, or when it can't be found
        YADAResourceException - when a query's source attribute can't be found in the application context, or there is another problem with the context
        YADAAdaptorException - when a query cannot be built by the adaptor
        YADARequestException - when filters are included in the request config, but can't be converted into a JSONObject
        YADAParserException - when query code cannot be parsed successfully
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • setGlobalHarmonyMaps

        private void setGlobalHarmonyMaps()
        Create a composite harmony map for all queries based on either YADARequest.getHarmonyMap() or the harmony maps stored in each query via param YADAQuery.getParam(String) named YADARequest.PS_HARMONYMAP. This object, consistent in each request, enables inclusion of both mapped and unmapped columns in a single result, specifically necessary for YADARequest.FORMAT_CSV and other delimited formats.
        Since:
        6.1.0

      • populateGlobalHarmonyMap

        private org.json.JSONObject populateGlobalHarmonyMap(org.json.JSONObject global,
                                           org.json.JSONObject local)
        Populates a JSONObject with the unique set of keys, i.e., original column or field names passed into the request in JSONParams or in the YADARequest.PS_HARMONYMAP parameter.
        Parameters:
        global - The JSONObject to populate
        local - The JSONObject containing the key/value pairs to transfer to global
        Returns:
        the global JSONObject containing the unique set of keys (and values)
        Since:
        6.1.0

      • setQueryHarmonyMaps

        private void setQueryHarmonyMaps()
                          throws YADARequestException
        Checks for a harmonyMap or h spec in the yadaReq. If null, iterates over the queries in the request, identifying those that have embedded h specs and those that do not. If any queries contain specs, those that do not are provided with empty maps.
        Throws:
        YADARequestException - when the resulting harmonyMap is non-compliant
        Since:
        6.1.0

      • storeConnection

        private void storeConnection(YADAQuery yq)
                      throws YADAConnectionException
        Adds the JDBC or SOAP connection object for yq to the internal index. If the connection is not yet in the index, it is created from the source stored in the yq object. If the protocol value in the query is not SOAP or JDBC, the method exits silently
        Parameters:
        yq - the query object containing the source string for setting the connection
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the connection to the source in the query cannot be set

      • commit

        public void commit(YADAQuery yq)
            throws YADAConnectionException
        Executes a query-level commit on the connection stored in the YADAQuery referenced by the parameter. If the connection object returned by the query is not a JDBC connection, but, for instance, a SOAPConnection, the error will be caught and handled gracefully.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the statements to commit
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the commit fails

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws YADAConnectionException
        Executes a commit on all connections created during processing of the current request.
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the commit fails

      • deferCommit

        private void deferCommit(String source)
        Adds source to the internal #deferredCommits list for execution of commit on the connection after results are parsed.
        Parameters:
        source - the jndi path of the source to commit later
        Since:
        0.4.2.0

      • releaseResources

        public void releaseResources()
                      throws YADAConnectionException
        This method attempts (and usually suceeds) to close all JDBC resources opened during processing of the current request, including ResultSets PreparedStatements and CallableStatements using the utility methods in ConnectionFactory
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when there is a problem closing any of the resources
        See Also:
        ConnectionFactory.releaseResources(ResultSet), ConnectionFactory.releaseResources(java.sql.Statement)

      • storeCallableStatement

        private void storeCallableStatement(YADAQuery yq,
                          String code)
        Adds the SQL function statement to the internal index
        Parameters:
        yq - the query object
        code - the raw code

      • storePreparedStatement

        private void storePreparedStatement(YADAQuery yq,
                          String code)
                             throws YADAConnectionException
        Adds the JDBC statement to the internal index
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the code and the index to which to add the statement
        code - the SQL to map to the statement
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the statement is not yet in the map, and the connection deliver it

      • storePreparedStatementForCount

        private void storePreparedStatementForCount(YADAQuery yq,
                                  PreparedStatement p,
                                  String code)
                                     throws YADAConnectionException
        Adds the JDBC statement to the internal index
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the code and the index to which to add the statement
        p - the statement for the data query, serving as a key for the count statement in the map
        code - the SQL to map to the statement
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the statement is not yet in the map, and the connection deliver it

      • storeSoapMessage

        private void storeSoapMessage(YADAQuery yq,
                    String code)
        Adds the SOAP message to the internal index
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the code and index
        code - the soap message

      • storeRestQuery

        private void storeRestQuery(YADAQuery yq,
                  String code)
        Adds the REST url string to the internal index
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the code and index
        code - the rest url string

      • prepQueriesForExecution

        private void prepQueriesForExecution()
                              throws YADAResourceException,
                                     YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException,
                                     YADAConnectionException,
                                     YADARequestException,
                                     YADAAdaptorException,
                                     YADAParserException
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when a query's source attribute can't be found in the application context, or there is another problem with the context
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when there is no adaptor available for the source or protocol or the intended adaptor can't be instantiated
        YADAConnectionException - when a connection to the source can't be opened
        YADARequestException - when filters are included in the request config, but can't be converted into a JSONObject
        YADAAdaptorException - when the query cannot be built by the adaptor
        YADAParserException - when the query code cannot be parsed successfully
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • endowQueries

        YADAQuery[] endowQueries(JSONParams jSONParams)
                   throws YADAConnectionException,
                          YADAFinderException,
                          YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                          YADAResourceException,
                          YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Populates the data and parameter storage in the query object, using values passed in request object
        Parameters:
        jSONParams - the request param containing the query information to process
        Returns:
        array of YADAQuery objects corresponding to JSONParams entries
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - when a query in jsonParams can't be found in the YADA index
        YADAConnectionException - when a connection to the YADA index can't be established
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - the the YADA request is malformed
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor attached to the query object can't be found or instantiated
        YADAResourceException - when the query q can't be found in the index
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • endowQuery

        YADAQuery endowQuery(YADAQuery yq,
                   JSONParamsEntry entry)
               throws YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                      YADAResourceException,
                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Populates the data and parameter storage in the yq object, using values passed entry
        Parameters:
        yq - the YADAQuery to augment
        entry - the JSONParamsEntry containing the values to store in the query
        Returns:
        the augmented version of yq
        Throws:
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - the the YADA request is malformed
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor attached to the query object can't be found or instantiated
        YADAResourceException - when the query q can't be found in the index
        Since:
        0.4.2.0

      • endowQuery

        YADAQuery endowQuery(String q)
               throws YADAConnectionException,
                      YADAFinderException,
                      YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                      YADAResourceException,
                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Populates the data and parameter storage in the query object, using values passed in request object. When the request has a qname and params, it is for a singular query.
        Parameters:
        q - the name of the query to process
        Returns:
        a YADAQuery object retrieved from the YADA index corresponding to q
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - when the query q can't be found in the YADA index
        YADAConnectionException - when a connection to the YADA index can't be established
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - the the YADA request is malformed
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor attached to the query object can't be found or instantiated
        YADAResourceException - when the query q can't be found in the index
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

      • endowQuery

        YADAQuery endowQuery(YADAQuery yq)
               throws YADAQueryConfigurationException,
                      YADAResourceException,
                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Populates the data and parameter storage in the query object, using values passed in request object
        Parameters:
        yq - the query object to be processed
        Returns:
        yq, now endowed with metadata
        Throws:
        YADAFinderException - when the name of the query in yq can't be found in the YADA index
        YADAQueryConfigurationException - the the YADA request is malformed
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor attached to the query object can't be found or instantiated
        YADAResourceException - when the query q can't be found in the index
        Since:
        0.4.0.0

        Returns:
        array of YADAQuery objects
        Since:

      • getQuery

        public YADAQuery getQuery(int index)
        Accessor for YADAQuery at index.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the desired query in the internal array
        Returns:
        YADAQuery at the desired index

      • getUpdateStats

        private boolean getUpdateStats()
        Returns the value of YADARequest.PS_UPDATE_STATS
        Returns:
        true by default, or false if set deliberately in the request
